item.title: Dragon Ball New Game Project AGE 1000 announced
item.content:encoded:
Bandai Namco has announced Dragon Ball New Game Project AGE 1000. It will launch in 2027. Platforms were not announced.

The game has been in development for six to seven years, including the initial concepting phase, and features a new character designed by late Dragon Ball creator Akira Toriyama.

More information about the game will be announced at Dragon Ball Games Battle Hour 2026, which will run from April 18 to 19, 2026 at Shrine Auditorium and Expo Hall in Los Angeles, California.

Here is all the information provided by Bandai Namco so far:

A brand-new Dragon Ball world and its entirely original characters—all brought to life by Akira Toriyama. For a new Game Project set for 2027!

Witness the debut of a never-before-seen character—designed by Akira Toriyama himself—within the new Dragon Ball world, “AGE 1000.”

And that’s not all—the “AGE 1000” project will introduce even more unique characters as the adventure unfolds.

The world of DRAGON BALL continues to expand. Stay tuned for what’s next!

The latest updates will be unveiled at Dragon Ball Games Battle Hour 2026 in the U.S. on April 18 to 19. Catch it in person or on the live stream!

Watch the announcement teaser trailer below.

Announce Teaser Trailer

item.title: Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition rated in Australia
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch

Original Rayman set to return on modern hardware?

Australian Classification has rated the unannounced Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition for PlayStation 5 and Switch.

The developer and publisher are listed as Atari, while the applicant is listed as U&I Entertainment.

Atari has previously worked on classic intellectual property outside of its own catalog, such as Mortal Kombat: Legacy Kollection, while U&I Entertainment has previously distributed physical editions of both Ubisoft and Atari titles, including The Rogue Prince of Persia. That being said, the rating is likely meant for the physical editions of the unannounced classic.

Back in September 2025, Ubisoft Montpellier and Ubisoft Milan teased “working together on the future of Rayman.”

More recently, Insider Gaming’s Tom Henderson, who is known for inside reports on Ubisoft happenings, said that two Rayman projects were in the works at Ubisoft—one code-named “Iceman” that is releasing “very, very soon” in celebration of the series’ recent 30th anniversary, and another code-named “Steambot,” which is a Rayman Legends remake. Both of these reports are unverified, but the contents of “Iceman” would up with today’s Rayman 30th Anniversary Edition rating.



https://www.gematsu.com/2026/01/rayman-30th-anniversary-edition-rated-in-australia
